intro: Racosperma kenneallyi, commonly known as the Kenneally's acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with compound leaves and yellow or pale green flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
